snippet: This sorry Broadway musical season mainly offered choices of the vulgar, the derivative or the insipid. Thank goodness there at least a few memorable individual performances.
abstract: Charles Isherwood laments the sorry state of Broadway musicals currently on stage; says the season's choices, many revivals of movies, are vulgar and derivative, saved only by a few memorable performances by individuals in the productions.
lead_paragraph: This sorry Broadway musical season mainly offered choices of the vulgar, the derivative or the insipid. Thank goodness there at least a few memorable individual performances.

headline.seo: An Off-Key Year for Broadway Musicals
headline.main: They Sure Weren’t Singing My Song
headline.print_headline: They Sure Weren’t Singing My Song
